member.summary: The number of bytes the resource uses within the package

member.summary: The number of bytes the resource uses in memory

member.name: P:s4pi.Package.ResourceIndexEntry.Compressed
member.summary: 0xFFFF if Filesize != Memsize, else 0x0000

member.summary: Always 0x0001

member.summary: A MemoryStream covering the index entry bytes

member.name: P:s4pi.Package.ResourceIndexEntry.IsDeleted
member.summary: True if the index entry has been deleted from the package index

member.name: P:s4pi.Package.ResourceIndexEntry.ResourceStream
member.summary: The uncompressed resource data associated with this index entry (used to save having to uncompress the same entry again if it's requested more than once) Setting the stream updates the Memsize

member.name: P:s4pi.Package.ResourceIndexEntry.IsDirty
member.summary: True if the index entry should be treated as dirty - e.g. the ResourceStream has been replaced

member.name: M:s4pi.Package.Package.OpenPackage(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Open an existing package by filename, read only
member.param: Fully qualified filename of the package
member.returns: IPackage reference to an existing package on disk
member.exception: is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

, or a component of the file name, exceeds the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.

is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters.
-or-
refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in an NTFS environment.
refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in a non-NTFS environment.
The caller does not have the required permission.
Thrown if the package header is malformed.

member.name: M:s4pi.Package.Package.OpenPackage(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Open an existing package by filename, optionally readwrite
member.param: Fully qualified filename of the package
True to indicate read/write access required
member.returns: IPackage reference to an existing package on disk
member.exception: is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

, or a component of the file name, exceeds the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.

is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters.
-or-
refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in an NTFS environment.
refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in a non-NTFS environment.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for , such as when access is ReadWrite and the file or directory is set for read-only access.
Thrown if the package header is malformed.
